content: Excellent, excellent list. However, I must disagree with this one: “Don’t Start A Relationship If You’re Not In Love” Arranged marriages have a higher success rate than romantically-formed marriages. I’m not advocating arranged marriage, but I’m illustrating that love is much more of a choice than it is a feeling. My wife and I are *opposites*. We didn’t realize this before we were married. As a result, the first few years were less than fun. But, we’ve stuck it out and have a sweet, mature love and respect for each other. And the fact that we’re opposites actually helps us in our work together (we do pre-engagement and premarital counseling for couples). I would, instead, say, “Don’t Start a Relationship If You Don’t have Compatible Life Goals/Similar Mission.” This will take a couple much farther. Grace be with you.
